Description: Mould-made miniature pottery lamp-holder in the form of a panelled drum surmounted by the mask of an African wearing a chaplet of vine leaves; on top is a suspension-lug. The lamp-opening is in the form of a door, with jambs and lintel. At the rear are two pierced holes; a leaf-shaped smoke-hole is cut through the back of the mask. Traces of the post-firing colouration survive.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q612.bis)
